summary: An email from an Australian lawyer to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and a Victim/Witness Coordinator, claiming to be a victim of Jeffrey Epstein's network and Prince Andrew, and providing submissions made to an Australian Royal Commission as evidence. The sender alleges both sexual and commercial offenses and requests to be added to the U.S. case against Epstein.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email; the sender is urgently requesting his attention and action regarding allegations against Jeffrey Epstein's network and Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the referenced U.S. criminal case; the sender claims to be a victim of Epstein's global network and associates.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Alleged by the sender to be part of Epstein's network; accused of involvement in the 'Pitch @ Palace Competition' where the sender's commercial information was stolen. The sender claims to have active cases against him.

persons.name: Ronald Sackville
persons.role: Chair of The Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability
persons.context: Australian official who has received the sender's formal submissions; the sender has requested a one-on-one meeting with him.

persons.name: Mikayla Brier Mills
persons.context: Named in an attachment filename as allegedly committing fraud and stealing money and confidential client information; specific connection to the sender's claims is not detailed in the provided text.

connections.description: The sender alleges Prince Andrew is part of Jeffrey Epstein's 'Circle/Network of Global Associates' involved in decades of rape and other serious criminal offenses.
The sender claims to be a victim of both sexual and commercial offenses committed by Jeffrey Epstein and his global network.
The sender claims to be a recent victim of Prince Andrew via the 'Pitch @ Palace Competition,' where commercial information was stolen, and has active cases against him.
The sender is formally contacting the U.S. Attorney to provide evidence and request to be added to the U.S. case against Jeffrey Epstein.
The sender has filed formal submissions with the Royal Commission chaired by Ronald Sackville and has requested a meeting.

events.title: Urgent Email to U.S. Attorney
events.description: An Australian lawyer sends an urgent, confidential email to Geoffrey Berman and a Victim/Witness Coordinator, alleging victimization by Jeffrey Epstein's network and Prince Andrew, and submitting evidence.

events.title: Submissions to Australian Royal Commission
events.description: The sender has filed around ten-plus formal submissions with the Australian Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability, alleging offenses related to Epstein's network.

events.title: Alleged Theft via Pitch @ Palace
events.description: The sender claims to be a recent victim of Prince Andrew and his 'Pitch @ Palace Competition,' where the sender's commercial and other information was stolen.

keyFacts: An Australian lawyer claims to be a victim of both sexual and commercial offenses committed by Jeffrey Epstein's global network and associates, including Prince Andrew.

The sender alleges Prince Andrew's 'Pitch @ Palace Competition' was used to steal the sender's commercial information, with active cases and an investigation by the UK Information Privacy Commissioner ongoing.

The sender has filed multiple formal submissions with the Australian Royal Commission into Violence, Abuse, Neglect and Exploitation of People with Disability, chaired by The Hon Ronald Sackville AO QC.
The email is an urgent request to U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman to be added to the case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein 19 Cr. 490 (RMB)' and to use the provided submissions as evidence.
Attachments reference allegations of fraud and theft by an individual named Mikayla Brier Mills, and a forwarded email mentions a picture of someone's son with Jeffrey Epstein in Minnesota.
